overview_summary: None of the five profiled neighbors have a clear public stance on development or clean energy, as no statements or actions could be found. All appear to be private landowners without known civic roles. Consequently, all five are categorized as having an unknown stance, and none are considered high-influence community figures (primarily low influence across the group).

neighbors.name: Mark and Lydia Sanders
neighbors.claims: Mark and Lydia Sanders are listed as co-owners of an Anderson County parcel (PIN 225-06-04-016) as per county property records ([www.andersoncountysc.org](https://www.andersoncountysc.org/departments-a-z/assessor/#:~:text=Viewer%20propertyviewer,m)). No news articles or public meeting minutes were found in which either Mark or Lydia Sanders commented on local development or energy projects ([obits.robinsonfuneralhomes.com](https://obits.robinsonfuneralhomes.com/mark-sanders#:~:text=Mark%20Ivan%20Sanders%2C%20of%20Seneca%2C,higher%20education%20at%20Lander%20College)). The only Sanders serving in Anderson County’s government is Brett Sanders (a council member), indicating Mark and Lydia hold no official positions ([www.andersoncountysc.org](https://www.andersoncountysc.org/county-council/#:~:text=,Chairman%20Entrepreneur%20owning%20and)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Begin with a personal, informational approach to learn their views, as they have no known public stance.

neighbors.name: Mark Jerome and Angelia Sloan
neighbors.claims: Mark Jerome Sloan and his spouse Angelia are the identified owners of Anderson County parcel 225-06-03-005 ([www.andersoncountysc.org](https://www.andersoncountysc.org/departments-a-z/assessor/#:~:text=Viewer%20propertyviewer,m)). There is no record of either Mark or Angelia Sloan making public statements about development or energy in local media or hearings (their names do not appear in relevant Anderson County records) ([www.andersoncountysc.org](https://www.andersoncountysc.org/county-council/#:~:text=,Chairman%20Entrepreneur%20owning%20and)). They have not been identified in any civic roles or offices in Anderson County ([www.andersoncountysc.org](https://www.andersoncountysc.org/county-council/#:~:text=,Chairman%20Entrepreneur%20owning%20and)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via direct, friendly outreach to gauge their perspectives privately since they have no public position.

neighbors.name: Kevin and Aida Annette Gray
neighbors.claims: Kevin Gray and Aida Annette Gray jointly own the property corresponding to PIN 225-11-01-005 in Anderson County ([www.andersoncountysc.org](https://www.andersoncountysc.org/departments-a-z/assessor/#:~:text=Viewer%20propertyviewer,m)). No evidence was found of this couple speaking out on land development or renewable energy issues in Anderson County (most media references to "Kevin Gray" in South Carolina refer to a well-known Columbia activist, not this landowner) ([www.blythewoodonline.com](https://www.blythewoodonline.com/2023/03/guest-editorial-activist-kevin-gray-was-larger-than-life-yet-unassuming/#:~:text=Tuesday%2C%20March%207%2C%202023%2C%20Columbia,of%20my%20most%20cherished%20friends)). They are not listed among local officials or board members, suggesting they have no formal influence in local governance ([www.sccounties.org](https://www.sccounties.org/county/anderson-county/directory#:~:text=Brett%20Sanders%20%20,1618)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a neighborly one-on-one conversation to share project information, as they haven’t signaled any stance publicly.

neighbors.name: Charles L. and Olene W. Burton (Life Estate)
neighbors.claims: Charles L. Burton and Olene W. Burton hold a life estate interest in their Anderson County property (PIN 225-06-03-009) ([www.scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/document/528899352/great-old-property-outline-detailed#:~:text=Patent%20www.scribd.com%20%20Ch.3%20,A%20can)). No public comments or letters from the Burtons about local development or solar projects were found in official records or news archives ([www.andersoncountysc.org](https://www.andersoncountysc.org/county-council/#:~:text=,Chairman%20Entrepreneur%20owning%20and)). They do not appear in any elected or appointed capacity locally, indicating they remain private retirees with no formal community leadership role ([www.sccounties.org](https://www.sccounties.org/county/anderson-county/directory#:~:text=Brett%20Sanders%20%20,1618)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Show respect for their long-term ownership and family legacy, listening to any concerns quietly in person due to their private profile.

neighbors.name: Brandy and Evin McIntyre
neighbors.claims: Brandy and Evin McIntyre own the parcel identified by PIN 225-06-02-008 in Anderson County ([www.andersoncountysc.org](https://www.andersoncountysc.org/departments-a-z/assessor/#:~:text=Viewer%20propertyviewer,m)). There are no indications of either Brandy or Evin McIntyre participating in public meetings or local media discussions regarding development plans (their names do not surface in available local records) ([www.sccounties.org](https://www.sccounties.org/county/anderson-county/directory#:~:text=Brett%20Sanders%20%20,1618)). They have not been noted to hold any community positions or to have a public presence around civic issues ([www.sccounties.org](https://www.sccounties.org/county/anderson-county/directory#:~:text=Brett%20Sanders%20%20,1618)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in an informal manner (e.g., via mutual acquaintances or a community gathering) to introduce the project and hear their thoughts, given their currently low-profile stance.
